Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of eating bananas as a preventative against COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or scientific support to prove that eating bananas can prevent COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that consuming bananas can prevent coronavirus without any scientific basis or endorsement from reputable sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that scientists at the University of Queensland have not made any claim about bananas preventing COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides alternative methods to protect against COVID-19, such as maintaining a safe distance and following basic sanitary procedures, which are more effective than eating bananas.
